intro: Euploca nesopelyda, commonly known as the Pseudostellaria, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant features small, clustered flowers with five petals, typically in shades of white or pale pink. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Euploca nesopelyda is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or rocky areas.
